thread.title: NAB to sell remaining Great Western shares
thread.title_full: NAB to sell remaining Great Western shares

title: NAB to sell remaining Great Western shares
text:
Tue, Jul 28, 2015, 6:42 PM NZST - New Zealand Markets closed NAB to sell remaining Great Western shares AAP – 5 hours ago View Photo 

National Australia Bank is aiming to raise $US385 million ($A529.76 million) when it sells its final stake in its former US subsidiary Great Western Bancorp through a public offering. 
The bank, which is refocusing on its core Australian and New Zealand operations, will sell 12.7 million shares as part of the offering, while Great Western has agreed to repurchase around $US60 million worth of NAB's holding. 
NAB also has given the underwriters the option to purchase 1.3 million shares at a price of $US23.50. 
If the offer is taken up in full, the bank says it will have fully divested its 28.5 per cent stake in the regional US lender. 
At 1040 AEST on Tuesday, NAB's shares were down 12 cents, or 0.35 per cent, at $33.79. 
The move is part of chief executive Andrew Thorburn's plan to cast off NAB's underperforming international businesses. 
The bank earlier in July said a demerger and initial public offering of its troubled Clydesdale subsidiary in the UK "remains a priority". 
It plans to spin off the business by the end of 2015. @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Myer to cut permanent staff for casuals AAP
